posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.71 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Help keep important information easily accessible with pinned messages. Your most frequently asked questions, dinner reservations, and vacation itineraries are already top of mind. Now they can be top of chat as well.

Pinned messages has been a long time coming but it’s available for 1:1s and groups - let us know your thoughts :) !

Complete list of new commits since 7.70.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.70.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
signal-2026-01-21-20-05-25-0141080×370 11.4 KB

Pinned Messages, wooooo!

Bug: the preview in the conversation list shows a read/delivery indicator when there shouldn’t be one.

Salt505:

Pinned Messages

Could you post a screenshot of the pin message flow/interface?

On WhatsApp it’s long press a message, press 3 vertical dots in the top right, then Pin, which lets you choose 24 hours, 7 days (default) or 30 days.

Would Signal be able to also show a calendar option to choose the specific date, and maybe even time, until which the message would remain pinned? Similar to scheduled messages.

Could this be extended to schedule a pinned message?

And is it possible to select more than one message to pin them simultaneously?

Finally, what about text formatting for pinned messages, maybe the spoiler effect?

Also spoiler text formatting for options in a poll?

posts.name: (he/him)
posts.cooked: you long press on the bubble, press “Pin” on the pop-up list, and get an option to pin it for 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, or forever.

posts.name: Michel
posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:

Could you post a screenshot of the pin message flow/interface?

We’ve described the flow and a lot of screenshots and answers to your questions in our latest post on our unofficial site AboutSignal

image335×719 50.4 KB

image335×719 44.3 KB

More answers to your questions:

Works quite similar to that green app, but Signal has a nice overview of pinned messages.

Not possible to select more than one message and pin simultaneously

Works with sent messages, so not scheduled

All text formatting works as well in Pinned messages

Contributor:

answers to your questions

Chatting with @Contributor, I asked what happens if someone pins a message (forever) and then they’re either removed from or leave a group. Imagine a bug where a pinned message can’t be unpinned because the original pinner isn’t in the group anymore

posts.name: Michel
posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:

Chatting with @Contributor, I asked what happens if someone pins a message (forever) and then they’re either removed from or leave a group. Imagine a bug where a pinned message can’t be unpinned because the original pinner isn’t in the group anymore

@Aku-Stable I just tested it after your question. Other admins (or members, depending on your Edit group info permission settings), can just unpin it at any time.

If you had it set to Admin only, and you were the only admin and leave the group, you have to assign a new admin anyway, so the new admin can do it after you left

Are there any plans to allow users to dismiss or otherwise hide pinned messages?
